edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.games.Models

Class TicTacToeModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.games.Models.TicTacToeModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TwoPlayerGameModel

    public class TicTacToeModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements TwoPlayerGameModel
    tictactoegame is a tic tac toe game object that stores data about a tic tac toe game, such as placement of Xs and Os, and possibly the winner
    Version:
    for CS56, Spring 2017
    Author:
    David Roster, Harrison Wang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkWinner()
      Checks to see who won by comparing three of a pattern whether diagonal, vertical, or horizontal.
      java.lang.String getState()
      Sees the current state of the board, and analyzes it to see if their is a current winner by calling the checkWinner() method.
      void init()
      Initializes the state of our grid board for the server.
      void setState(java.lang.String data)
      Parses our incoming string into an array and defines the new state of our Tic Tac Toe grid.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the state of our grid board for the server. That way the server can also follow the game closely and make announcements off the flow of the game.

      • checkWinner

        public boolean checkWinner()
        Checks to see who won by comparing three of a pattern whether diagonal, vertical, or horizontal. Only returns true/false since this is a helper method but can print "no winner found" if the game is still contuing.
        Specified by:
        checkWinner in interface TwoPlayerGameModel
        Returns:
        has someone won the game

      • setState

        public void setState(java.lang.String data)
        Parses our incoming string into an array and defines the new state of our Tic Tac Toe grid.
        Specified by:
        setState in interface TwoPlayerGameModel
        Parameters:
        data - the state of the game

      • getState

        public java.lang.String getState()
        Sees the current state of the board, and analyzes it to see if their is a current winner by calling the checkWinner() method.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface TwoPlayerGameModel
        Returns:
        the current state of the instance variables for the game
